critter.name: Bitterling
critter.desc: Bitterlings hide their eggs inside large bivalves-like clams-where the young can stay safe until grown. The bitterling isn't being sneaky. No, their young help keep the bivalve healthy by eating invading parasites! It's a wonderful bit of evolutionary deal making, don't you think? Each one keeping the other safe... Though eating parasites does not sound like a happy childhood... Is that why the fish is so bitter?
critter.quote: I caught a bitterling! It's mad at me, but only a little.
